text: Is there a memory efficient and fast way to load big json files in python?
I have some json files with 500MB.
If I use the "trivial" json.load to load its content all at once, it will consume a lot of memory.
Is there a way to read partially the file?
If it was a text, line delimited file, I would be able to iterate over the lines.
I am looking for analogy to it.
